description:
'''Aubrey Drake Graham''' (born October 24, 1986) is a Canadian rapper, singer, and actor.  Regarded as [[Billboard and Vibe's 50 Greatest Rappers of All Time|one of the greatest rappers of all time]], he is credited with popularizing [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] sensibilities in [[hip-hop]] music. Drake first gained recognition by starring as [[Jimmy Brooks]] in the [[CTV Television Network]] teen drama series ''[[Degrassi: The Next Generation]]'' (2001–2008) and began his music career by releasing the mixtapes ''[[Room for Improvement (mixtape)|Room for Improvement]]'' (2006), ''[[Comeback Season (mixtape)|Comeback Season]]'' (2007), and ''[[So Far Gone (mixtape)|So Far Gone]]'' (2009). 

After signing with [[Young Money Entertainment]], Drake released his debut album ''[[Thank Me Later]]'' (2010), which debuted atop the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart. All of his subsequent albums—including ''[[Take Care]]'' (2011), ''[[Nothing Was the Same]]'' (2013), ''[[Scorpion (Drake album)|Scorpion]]'' (2018), ''[[Honestly, Nevermind]]'' (2022) and ''[[For All the Dogs]]'' (2023)—reached number-one in the US. ''[[Views (album)|Views]]'' (2016) led the ''Billboard'' 200 for 13 weeks and ''[[Certified Lover Boy]]'' (2021) set the then-record for [[List of Billboard Hot 100 chart achievements and milestones#Most top ten songs from one album|most US top-ten songs from one album]] (9). Drake's collaborative albums include ''[[Her Loss]]'' (2022), with [[21 Savage]], and ''[[Some Sexy Songs 4 U]]'' (2025), with [[PartyNextDoor]]. His catalogue of high-charting singles include "[[Best I Ever Had]]", "[[Find Your Love]]", "[[Take Care (song)|Take Care]]", "[[Started from the Bottom]]", "[[Hold On, We're Going Home]]", "[[Hotline Bling]]", "[[One Dance]]", "[[Passionfruit (song)|Passionfruit]]", "[[God's Plan (song)|God's Plan]]", "[[Nice for What]]", "[[In My Feelings]]", "[[Toosie Slide]]", "[[Way 2 Sexy]]", "[[Fair Trade (song)|Fair Trade]]", "[[Jimmy Cooks]]", "[[Rich Flex]]", "[[Slime You Out]]", "[[First Person Shooter (song)|First Person Shooter]]", and "[[Nokia (song)|Nokia]]".

As an entrepreneur, Drake founded the [[OVO Sound]] record label with longtime collaborator [[40 (producer)|40]] in 2012. In 2013, he became the "global ambassador" of the [[Toronto Raptors]], joining their executive committee and later obtaining naming rights to their practice facility [[OVO Athletic Centre]]. In 2016, he began collaborating with [[Brent Hocking]] on the [[bourbon whiskey]] [[Virginia Black Whiskey|Virginia Black]]. Drake heads the OVO fashion label and the Nocta collaboration with [[Nike, Inc.]], and founded the production company [[DreamCrew]] and the fragrance house Better World. In 2018, he was reportedly responsible for 5% (CAD$440 million) of Toronto's CAD$8.8 billion annual tourism income. Drake has been subject of widespread media coverage due to his popularity, lifestyle, relationships, and feuds with other rappers, including [[Drake–Kanye West feud|Kanye West]] and [[Drake–Kendrick Lamar feud|Kendrick Lamar]], the latter of which led to [[Drake–Kendrick Lamar feud#Full song chronology|several diss tracks in 2024]].

Among the world's [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists]], with over 170 million units sold, Drake is ranked as the highest-certified [[List of highest-certified music artists in the United States|digital singles]] artist in the United States by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). [[List of awards and nominations received by Drake|His accolades]] consist of 5 [[Grammy Award]]s, 6 [[American Music Awards]], [[Billboard Music Award#Most wins|39 ''Billboard'' Music Awards]], 2 [[Brit Awards]], and 3 [[Juno Awards]]. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' named him the [[Billboard Decade-End#2010s|Artist of the Decade (2010s)]] and the [[Billboard's Greatest Pop Stars#21st Century|fourth greatest pop star of the 21st century]]. He has achieved 14 [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] number-one albums, a [[Billboard 200#Most number-one albums|joint-record among soloists]], and 13 [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] number-one singles, a [[List of Billboard Hot 100 chart achievements and milestones#Most number-one songs|joint-record for a male solo artist]].{{efn|This excludes his appearance on the number-one single "[[Sicko Mode]]" for which he did not receive official credit.}} Drake holds further Hot 100 records, including the most top 10 singles (80), the most top 40 singles (217), the most charted songs (358) and the most consecutive weeks on the chart (431). He additionally has the most number-one singles on the [[R&B/Hip-Hop Airplay]], [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]], [[Hot Rap Songs]], and [[Rhythmic Airplay]] charts.
